intro: Phelipanche orientalis, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is an annual herb that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often hairy. It thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields and along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to compete with other plants.
